document.title: College, Career, and Civic Life (C3) Framework for Social Studies State Standards

jurisdiction.title: National Council for the Social Studies

CBBD4AEABB8449A98AB281806ED335BF.description: Use listening, consensus-building, and voting procedures to decide on and take action in their classrooms.

80375A80EFC84C1C8654A53C041EC6B6.description: Identify ways to take action to help address local, regional, and global problems.

BEDA958CDAB84700BB904C458578BF8B.description: Identify and explain a range of local, regional, and global problems, and some ways in which people are trying to address these problems.

3E4378754FAC4D859ABEE8455D60157D.description: Ask and answer questions about explanations

2BD8B12F550647C5BE3ED6EA67E10CBF.description: Ask and answer questions about arguments.

C32C306051524EA787CF13A81620C11D.description: Present a summary of an argument using print, oral, and digital technologies.

1595FDEF33864839BEFB90DB278609E4.description: Construct explanations using correct sequence and relevant information.

1BD658E9D3BD4B17908B3C9668032E5C.description: Evaluate a source by distinguishing between fact and opinion.

7684B739818D4084B0FB8072432DCD1C.description: Gather relevant information from one or two sources while using the origin and structure to guide the selection.

724651A75D334745809317FEC700719F.description: Select which reasons might be more likely than others to explain a historical event or development.

B98B5BB665E3406C90A33BAC87273731.description: Generate possible reasons for an event or development in the past.

F52CB095DE784A5BBC908387FAA2CEB1.description: Generate questions about a particular historical source as it relates to a particular historical event or development.

058DFB149159459E982E346AE88CB7D4.description: Identify the maker, date, and place of origin for a historical source from information within the source itself.

E23F37D1365344959452712003E9B16C.description: Explain how historical sources can be used to study the past.

6508A1764ADF4C50ADDFBB7CAAB64D52.description: Identify different kinds of historical sources.

FF64C1CD93174D25A8AFE650E8026BFF.description: Compare different accounts of the same historical event.

90840B9AB073478AB80060BCB422A77E.description: Compare perspectives of people in the past to those of people in the present.

B104FCF18935469392B1B05534C31E4A.description: Generate questions about individuals and groups who have shaped a significant historical change.

CD6A2441893F4ECBB89E1AEB1438A104.description: Compare life in the past to life today.

3E2C3216903A4941981D0807044328BB.description: Create a chronological sequence of multiple events.

3CF2FEEE8C04428485D377BA00066083.description: Identify ways that a catastrophic disaster may affect people living in a place.

980C1846BCFE44D78A1C936AAA993B57.description: Explain how the consumption of products connects people to distant places.

DA7E8A5E608A4503A9A1C608EB7CE2CF.description: Describe changes in the physical and cultural characteristics of various world regions.

33520159E3154E68A362F5F25C57C0B2.description: Describe the connections between the physical environment of a place and the economic activities found there.

33BE9F430A3D46FF85AF3AEC732590AB.description: Compare how people in different types of communities use local and distant environments to meet their daily needs.

D52827D2E8D14406BEEAC1936F662CD9.description: Explain why and how people, goods, and ideas move from place to place.

2E56B4C13D5B4B53B1410A41FE5CB766.description: Human Population: Spatial Patterns and Movements

18B6C06FA3F647C083ED4F544A5AEDF9.description: Identify some cultural and environmental characteristics of specific places.

E04A4C421AEA47649AF4469B7C3894B0.description: Describe how human activities affect the cultural and environmental characteristics of places or regions.

5C199E26974C4B219CBE52BD07838227.description: Explain how weather, climate, and other environmental characteristics affect people's lives in a place or region.

6654A24B2AB84B6D9859D9A4CE10BA9B.description: Human-Environment Interaction: Place, Regions, and Culture

7AECB76045BA40BD8265F3656B03DBE2.description: Use maps, globes, and other simple geographic models to identify cultural and environmental characteristics of places.

6BE193E5C24445C68F89DE84D2CF5772.description: Use maps, graphs, photographs, and other representations to describe places and the relationships and interactions that shape them.

8E85455E4B6F46D59450613AF738528E.description: Construct maps, graphs, and other representations of familiar places.

106CBB550E574932B4542DEFD51244DB.description: Geographic Representations: Spatial Views of the World

70E8D3930E5342CB99E77C1D9EE7DE18.description: Describe products that are produced abroad and sold domestically and products that are produced domestically and sold abroad.

C812A4371589454A89374C6CF6AEB505.description: Describe why people in one country trade goods and services with people in other countries.

0AC0EE2B8E1D48B1992924A1C8D5492D.description: Describe examples of capital goods and human capital.

51CA05E5C50449E397B74F1220392749.description: Describe examples of the goods and services that governments provide.

69EE090F0C1743F1B0C864E3C6FE878C.description: Describe the role of banks in an economy.

DCAA652ED37E4F49A012B1287A8A7E4F.description: Describe examples of costs of production.

C81DE80CE11C4542BCFFCFF09103DF83.description: Identify prices of products in a local market.

8ADFC35367D2492EA97D3519C38A455E.description: Describe the goods and services that people in the local community produce and those that are produced in other communities.

CAE9F2C661654193AD5F4B1C51411AA2.description: Describe the skills and knowledge required to produce certain goods and services.

5F7AC90E3D934A1F9BC3E90FAB938661.description: Identify the benefits and costs of making various personal decisions.

AC9A988F6CF64EF2AB9E32F3E7BA74DA.description: Explain how scarcity necessitates decision making.

0B504D4EBB7748F58D097FC718B6D64C.description: Describe how people have tried to improve their communities over time.

18CBC37834D74005B3DD4F83E0BED50D.description: Identify and explain how rules function in public (classroom and school) settings.

01B4BC5DEF9F47CA94B421322182F201.description: Explain how people can work together to make decisions in the classroom.

C93758373DE843DA8AB49742DDBF22C2.description: Compare their own point of view with others' perspectives.

6831461CF155466FA9F369F494477C68.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions while responding attentively to others when addressing ideas and making decisions as a group.

DBF4196F1E3E417B83438BD5EFF82B92.description: Describe democratic principles such as equality, fairness, and respect for legitimate authority and rules.

E13F876049024FB88EC99C03C31EF2FD.description: Apply civic virtues when participating in school settings.

74759C165B394074A9D32978C96DE4CD.description: Participation and Deliberation: Applying Civic Virtues and Democratic Principles

412E7F71AF84440ABBDD60ECC4CEBB31.description: Describe how communities work to accomplish common tasks, establish responsibilities, and fulfill roles of authority.

2107B019F6614DA1A4E85E940F322D8B.description: Explain what governments are and some of their functions.

141B8444811145D6A16D592E4F750BB0.description: Explain the need for and purposes of rules in various settings inside and outside of school.

823B8CCF073543E08149D3EE40A0D164.description: Explain how all people, not just official leaders, play important roles in a community.

160CEFE5D8FB4861B21A9D8755B0A293.description: Describe roles and responsibilities of people in authority.

3153FC4CF06D416EB7A9A2C109E043EF.description: Determine the kinds of sources that will be helpful in answering compelling and supporting questions.

653DCD2B3C5349EC99C0D897EFEF5E19.description: Make connections between supporting questions and compelling questions.

51844BB9EC5A4C488105CE6C097C36F7.description: Identify facts and concepts associated with a supporting question.

2B41F669790C4EF7ABF9E8A633FA644D.description: Identify disciplinary ideas associated with a compelling question.

7244A72B43DB4BDBA2DBCB082103529B.description: Explain why the compelling question is important to the student.
